message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
The user is asking me to respond to a survey about AI in education as if I were a primary or secondary school teacher from Czechia. I need to provide responses for each of the 10 statements.

Let me think through each statement carefully and provide thoughtful responses that would be reasonable from a teacher's perspective:

[TT4G35A]: AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans - This is generally true. AI tools like ChatGPT can help draft lesson plans. I'd say "Agree"

[TT4G35B]: AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities - This is a capability that AI can have, though it depends on implementation. "Agree"

[TT4G35C]: AI assists teachers in supporting students individually - AI can provide personalized feedback and recommendations. "Agree"

[TT4G35D]: AI supports students with specific needs - AI can help with translation, text-to-speech, etc. "Agree"

[TT4G35E]: AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks - Yes, grading, attendance, scheduling can be automated. "Strongly agree"

[TT4G35F]: AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own - This is a real concern, but it's more of a risk/risk factor. As a teacher, I'd acknowledge this risk. "Agree"

[TT4G35G]: AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct - AI can make errors and inappropriate suggestions. "Agree"

[TT4G35H]: AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions - This is a known concern with AI bias. "Agree"

[TT4G35I]: AI jeopardises the privacy and security of student data - This is a valid concern. "Agree"

[TT4G35J]: AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches - This is possible if AI doesn't fully understand pedagogical context. "Agree"

I need to structure this as a function call with all the responses in an array format.
